quote: So many new faces. Students from India who have never been at a Halloween party, newcomer families came with their children. It was very noisy but we all found ways to talk to each other and laugh together.
Everyone had a wish to share! There were many families from Bhutan and the kids and adults who are still learning English wrote their wishes and hung them on the tree too!
Life's better working together! We are having our meetings during winter not in the community room but in the lobby of the building where one of our members live who uses wheelchair.
Thanks to the generous prize from the Early Bird Draw, Colin was able to do his own shopping in preparation for his snack bar!  Having treats-a-plenty meant that many guests opted to stay.

We love people using the park in fun, family friendly, inclusive ways, especially after dark. We believe one of the best ways to challenge any negative conceptions of the park after dark is to have people actually be in the park after dark. We had approximately double the number of pumpkins this year which was great. We hope to continue to grow this event in the future.

We of course strive to make all of our events inclusive, environmentally friendly, and promote safety but this event really sought to celebrate the history of our neighbourhood. We sought out local neighbourhood historians to research and present neighbourhood-specific questions for our trivia, our prizes included historical neighbourhood maps and Victoria Park mug. We ensured that we also had a round of trivia just for the kids to include them in the evening.

The BCA is proud of this event as it is family oriented, inclusive to all ages, heritages and offered as a result of a collaboration with the Lions, Brownies, Bridgeport Quilters and the Bridgeport Menâ€™s Coffee Group.
